runs.comm: swings away from the left-hander who drives at it and misses, there was none of that in the first innings at all
swings away again and beats Lumb's drive, good length
similar line, bit wider and left alone
fuller and straighter, clipped out to deep square leg
full ball, clipped wide of short long leg as it shaped back into the pads, deep square leg runs around to his right and saves very well
pushed at just outside off, gets it to long off
length ball on the stumps, patted back to the bowler
full ball on leg stumps, flicked into the crowd, picked up really nicely
goes again but misses, strikes the thigh pad and runs for a single to short long leg
full ball, strikes the pads and runs wide of the 45 for a single
swung across the line from just outside off, gets a bottom edge that finds the 45
length just outside off, lifted over cover, not got all of it but three out towards the cover rope, controlled stroke
length just outside off and flicked over midwicket, shuffled slightly across his stumps and struck it really well again
around the wicket now, full and timed superbly on the drive mid-off who fumbles
full on leg stump and whacked into the stands behind square on the leg side, got plenty of it and it flew over deep-backward square

bit swing, huge top edge, that is coming down with snow on it, long leg gets there but is totally off kilter and lets is through his hands, it boucnes and runs into the rope, such a tough chance, no ball too
superb delivery, leg stump yorker, off the pad towards square leg
length ball just outside off, clipped over the covers, decent timing, it pitches and skips away into the rope
fuller and wider, Lumb is after it and strikes it well over cover again and gets four again, almost six, lovely timing
around the wicket, full on leg stump, whacked over mid-on, decent strike, that's the area to hit on this pitch
tossed up a little, flicked at and it's in the air and just past a diving midwicket
beauty, full on the stumps and struck sweetly over the bowler's head

fuller and straighter, yorker length and it runs off the pads onto the stumps. McCullum has fired it in at 60mph, Lumb tried to play straight but was deceived by some drift to leg, he was beaten and it runs off the boot onto middle and leg stumps
full just outside off, a little width for Wright to slap it and gets it past extra-cover, well timed
tighter line and finds mid-off with a forward press this time
fired in on the stumps, Hales backs away a little and cuts through cover and despite a long chase it goes for four, well played
off stump, played off the back foot to extra-cover
tried to step across the stumps, it was fired in at the stumps and Hales just played it back to the bowler
swings this towards the leg side and gets a bottom edge through midwicket for a single
down the wicket and clipped through midwicket, the sweeper charges in and saves the second
down the wicket and hit hard to mid-off
length ball on the stumps, blocked into the covers
clears the front leg and swings a length ball on middle towards the on side, midwicket makes a great save
shuffles to leg and takes a full ball on off stump behind square on the leg side for a couple
same stroke, the line was a little straight and this is flicked past the short long leg who might have done better
very full and wide of the off stump, swung at and missed
slower ball, 66mph, driven from off stump to cover point
tossed up on the stumps, pulled down to long on
flatter and quicker on the stumps, pushed out through square leg
full ball, slapped down the ground and four, powerful hit that, narrowly evaded the stumps
slower, shorter, wide, cut without timing to deep cover
a nasty heave that comes off a thick inside edge to deep midwicket
down the pitch, Hira responds with a quicker, flatter ball that Wright has to counter-respond to, he nudges it down to long on
length ball on the stumps, pulled and finds deep square leg
back of a length just outside off, cut and the sweeper comes to his right and is able to save the second
back of a length, pulled, doesn't time it and gets it to deep midwicket
full outside off, driven hard but straight to extra-cover, Hales frustrated
steps across his stumps and takes a length ball on the pad that runs to short long leg, must have pitched outside leg stump, maybe too high too
back of a length, pulled out to deep square and they run very hard and get back for the second
slower ball, Hales came a long way down and missed completely but missed stumping as Latham totally fumbles it
swung to leg and finds the cow corner fence from off stump, right old slug but effective
outside off, very slow, cut and gets a bottom edge inside short third man for a single
back and slaps a length ball down to long off
down the ground again with a back foot slap to long off
Another hoik, this loops over the in-field in the covers and they get a runs out to the deep cover
down the wicket and pushes wide of long on, well placed so they get a second
steps a long way to leg, McNath follows him and Wright is struck on the pads looking to play to leg in the end
down the wicket again, tried to fire it in but turns into the full toss and Wright swings hard and gets four behind square, placed that well
placed well again, low full toss on the stumps, slapped wide of long on
steps back and watches it slide down the leg side
step to leg again, then a step back and a pull to backward square leg
full on the stumps rolled into the on side, they run hard but deep midwicket comes in to save the second
full on the off stump, slapped down to long on
waited for and cut, the deep cover is able to come to save that

full toss on the stumps and slugged into the on side and finds deep midwicket. Hales showing his lack of form there, that should have gone out of park but he got it off the outer half of the bat and it fell easily for Franklin in the deep to take a simple chance, didn't have far to move
back of a length on off stump, tucked to cover playing back
full just outside off stump, driven hard wide of long-off for two
turn away from the off stump and too wide
awful ball, straight full toss and the extra ball has gone into the crowd, ruined the end of an excellent spell
full just wide of the off stump, pushed wide of mid-off for a single
short ball, hurries Wright trying to hook and he gets it off the toe end up the wicket
back of a length just outside off stump, late cut wide of third man but it gets down there too quickly for a second
length on the stumps, blocked into the covers
well wide of off stump, slashes at and gets a toe end down to third man
slower ball, 64mph, low full toss outside off, Wright gets down to it stepping to leg and lifts it just wide of mid-off who dives but can't take it
full on the stumps, carefully knocked into the on side and they sprint for two between fielders
down the track and pushed firmly to extra-cover
guided off the stumps to backward point giving himself a little room
steps across the stumps and gets a length ball off the thigh pad to short long leg
low full toss hammered down to long off
full and wide, chipped over the in-field, the sweeper has to go a long way to his left to field and saves four
short ball, pulled and well struck, Hira is off from deep square, dives, parries but can't keep it off the rope
same area, this time closer to the fielder and just a single, fifty for Wright in 29 balls, great knock
back of a length, slugged to the leg side and finds the sweeper
opens up the off side and slaps from length on the stumps to deep cover point

slapped outside off stump and caught at slip! I had no idea a slip was even in place! Why would you have a slip at this stage for? But Ross Taylor is in there and has held a blinder high to his right with one hand, a blinder of a catch from a thick top edge, just an outstanding take, got up so high and clung on, what a catch, what a move from McCullum, Morgan was cutting but it bounced a bit on him and he's gone
back of a length on the stumps, dropped carefully into the leg side and, with all the fielders on the rope, they take two
full on off stump, Wright aimed over the leg side and swung and missed, narrowly evaded off stump
just outside off stump, dabbed to third man for a single
full on the stumps, blocked up the wicket
just outside off, dabbed down to third man
short ball, pulled and missed, slower ball bouncer it was

full and wide again, swung at, edged and caught behind. And this time the extra delivery takes a wicket. It was very full and very well, Wright reaches out to it and swung hard but got a healthy edge that Latham held going to his right hand side
back of a length, pulled to deep midwicket
short ball around off stump, Buttler sways inside it
fuller and comes off thigh pad towards square leg
back of a length just outside off, flicked at and gets it to deep cover
full just outside off, Buttler comes forward and drives over extra-cover, nicely timed stroke and a much-needed boundary
middle and leg now, clipped through square leg and they get a couple as deep square leg runs in
length ball angled past the off stump, a huge swing and a huge miss

steps across the stumps, length ball swung to leg, straight to short long leg and straight through the fielder! How has he missed that, just totally misjudged it and it's through his hands, Bopara thought he was gone
full outside off and a gorgeous upper-drive over extra-cover, great timing
leg side heave from off the stumps, Rutherford at deep backward square slides and saves four, superb work
Bopara stepped across his stumps, Anderson responds by going well wide of off stump but it was off the strip, Morkel-esque

on the stumps, Bopara got leg side of it again, Anderson went for the stumps but Bopara picked it up over long leg and finds the fence, in fact flies it all the way. That has sailed over the short boundary
across the stumps again, flicks it from off stump wide of long on but again a superb diving save, this time it's McNath, saves four again, wonderful work in the outfield
length ball dabbed into the on side, they scramble two as the field is back again
full on middle and leg, again dribble to the on side and again they get two, the field is far too deep out there
down the track and then swept, gets it to deep-backward square leg
swept and gets two out to the deep backward square
full, down the track, get a toe end back to the bowler
down to sweep, it's well down leg, miss and it's wide but he gets a top edge fine of deep backward square and it's two more
goes for the conventional - if that can be used to describe this shot - paddle and gets it very fine for six, taken from a good two feet outside off and gets enough on it
cramps him up, well bowled, length angled in, comes off the pad into the off side for a single
low full toss, swung over the leg side, one bounce short of deep midwicket, slower ball, brave but well bowled

goes for another paddle, slower ball, misses, Bopara calls him through for a bye, Latham, with gloves on, throws, missed the striker's end but finds the non-striker's end and Buttler is short of his ground what a slice of luck, that happened at Cardiff too when New Zealand played Sri Lanka
steps across his stumps, swings to leg, good contact but doesn't beat the fielder, New Zealand edge ahead
length on off stump, dabs behind point and it's just a single
swung into the leg side, has this got enough, it does! Picked up from a length on the stumps and swung over midwicket
bit swing and miss outside off stump, it was full and wide of off stump and he missed completely
tries the bouncer, short, pulls, get a toe down to long on, just a single
goes to swing to leg and misses, comes off the pad and they just take a single
length just outside off, cracked down to long on
leg side heave but just gets it to deep-backward square and that's just a single
